bibl.title: Letter from Wade H. Frost to Henry Rose Carter, March 23, 1922

div1.p: Frost comments on influenza epidemics in Panama.

div1.head: Letter from Wade H. Frost to Henry Rose Carter, March 23, 1922
div1.opener:
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
SCHOOL OF HYGIENE AND PUBLIC HEALTH
310-312 WEST MONUMENT STREET
BALTIMORE, MD. March 23, 1922.
DEPARTMENT OF EPIDEMIOLOGY
Dr. H. R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Thanks for your letter. The honorarium
comes, of course, from University funds for that
purpose so you need feel no compunction about accept-
ance.

The man whose name you ask, whom you met
here, is Dr. John Sundwall, Professor of Hygiene at the
University of Michigan, where he succeeds Dr. Victor
Vaughan.

As to the interval between epidemics in
Panama I did not intend to imply that this is of
itself significant; it is of interest only as taken
in connection with the numerous observations showing
similar intervals between definite epidemics of in-
fluenza elsewhere.

I am returning your manuscript to you
today, having made a copy.

Again thanking you for your very great
services,
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, W. H. Frost. WHP:G
